arm_group.description:
The keloid will be treated with intratumoral injection of calcium chloride followed by electrotransfer. It is a once only treatment.
Calcium chlorid concentration is 9 mg/ml Total dose is 0,5ml/cm3 tumor volume.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of calcium electroporation on keloids.

clinical_study.brief_title: Calcium Electroporation for the Treatment of Keloids

detailed_description.textblock:
The keloids wil be treated with intratumoral injection of calcium followed by
      electroporation. It is a once only treatment and the patients will be followed up for 24
      months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  At least 1 keloid available to electroporation.

          -  Patient should have been offered standard treatment.

          -  At least 8 weeks since other keloid treatment.

          -  Performance status <2 (ECOG).

          -  Platelet count >50 mia/l

          -  International Normalized Ratio (INR) <1,2.

          -  Age >18.

          -  Patient should be able to understand participants information.

          -  Signed, informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinically significant coagulopathy.

          -  Pregnancy or lactation.

          -  Participation in other clinical trial involving experimental drugs or participation
             in a clinical trial within 4 weeks before study treatment.

facility.name: Department of Oncology, Copenhagen University hospital, Herlev

clinical_study.official_title: Calcium Electroporation for the Treatment of Keloids

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description: Vancouver scar scale evaluate the keloids by: pigmentation, pliability, height, and vascularity.
primary_outcome.measure: Response evaluated by Vancouver Scar Scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Describe adverse events using Common Terminology for Adverse Events, version 4.0

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
